title: Identify What We Are Looking For
text: We are looking for the amount of sodium in a hot dog. We also do not know how much sodium is in a cup of cottage cheese.
speech: We are looking for the amount of sodium in a hot dog. We also do not know how much sodium is in a cup of cottage cheese.
pacedSpeech: We are looking for the amount of sodium in a hot dog. We also do not know how much sodium is in a cup of cottage cheese.

title: Name What We Are Looking For
text: Choose a variable to represent that quantity. Let $$h=the$$ amount of sodium in hot dog. Let $$c=the$$ amount of sodium in cottage cheese.
speech: Choose a variable to represent that quantity. Let  h is equal to, t h e,  amount of sodium in hot dog. Let  c is equal to, t h e  amount of sodium in cottage cheese.

title: Translate into a System of Equations
text: The total amount of sodium in $$2$$ hot dogs and $$3$$ cups of cottage cheese is $$4720$$ mg: $$2h+3c=4720$$.
speech: The total amount of sodium in  2  hot dogs and  3  cups of cottage cheese is  4720  mg:  2 h plus 3 c is equal to 4720 .
pacedSpeech: The total amount of sodium in   2
hot dogs and   3
cups of cottage cheese is   4720
mg:   2 h plus 3 c is equal to 4720

title: Translate into a System of Equations
text: The total amount of sodium in $$5$$ hot dogs and $$2$$ cups of cottage cheese is $$6300$$ mg: $$5h+2c=6300$$.
speech: The total amount of sodium in  5  hot dogs and  2  cups of cottage cheese is  6300  mg:  5 h plus 2 c is equal to 6300 .
pacedSpeech: The total amount of sodium in   5
hot dogs and   2
cups of cottage cheese is   6300
mg:   5 h plus 2 c is equal to 6300

title: Solve the System of Equations
text: To solve the system of equations, use elimination. The equations are in standard form. To get opposite coefficients of c, multiply the first equation by $$-2$$ and the second equation by $$3$$.\n(2*h+3*c=4720)*-2\n(5*h+2*c=6300)*3
speech: To solve the system of equations, use elimination. The equations are in standard form. To get opposite coefficients of c, multiply the first equation by  minus 2  and the second equation by  3 .\n(2*h+3*c=4720)*-2\n(5*h+2*c=6300)*3
pacedSpeech: To solve the system of equations, use elimination. The equations are in standard form. To get opposite coefficients of c, multiply the first equation by   minus 2
and the second equation by   3

title: Eliminate a Variable
speech: Add the two equations.\n minus 4 h minus 6 c is equal to negative 9440 \n 15 h plus 6 c is equal to 18900

15 h plus 6 c is equal to 18900

title: Solve for $$h$$
text: c will be eliminated and then solve for $$h$$.\n$$11h=9460$$\n$$h=860$$
speech: c will be eliminated and then solve for  h .\n 11 h, is equal to 9460 \n h, is equal to 860

title: Amount of Sodium
text: There is $$860$$ mg of sodium in the hotdog.
speech: There is  860  mg of sodium in the hotdog.
